gurmukhi: puhp DnK Alpnc mqs ijh ibrwjY ] bwjq JwJr qUr mDur bInw Dun bwjY ]
transliteration: Puhap Dhanakh Alpanach Matas Jih Dhujaa Biraajai|| Baajat Jhaajhar Toor Madhur Beenaa Dhoun Baajai||
translation: In this likeness of the god of love, he is an elegant Purusha and his banner looks glorious; on all his four sides, the pretty and sweet lyre is played and the horn is blown;

gurmukhi: sB bjqR ijh sMg bjq suMdr Cb sohq ] sMg sYn Ablw sMbUh sur nr mun mohq ]
transliteration: Sabh Bajatra Jih San Bajat Soundar Chhab Sohat|| San Sain Ablaa Sanbooh Sur Nar Mounndmohat||
translation: All types of musical instruments continue to be played with him; there is always a group of women with him and these women fascinate the mind of gods, men and sages;

gurmukhi: As mdn rwj rwjw niRpq jidn kRu`iD kir Dwie hY ] ibn eyk ibbyk qw ky smuih Aaur dUsr ko jwie hY ]170]
transliteration: As Madan Raaj Raajaa Nripat Jading Kruddh(i) Kar(i) Khaae Hai|| Bin Ek Bibek Taa Ke Samuh(i) Aur Doosar Ko Jaae Hai||170||
translation: On the day, when this Avivek will get enraged and come forward as the god of love, none will be able to stand before him except only Vivek.170.

gurmukhi: krq niRq suMdrI bjq bInw Dun mMgl ] aupjq rwg sMbUh bjq bYrwrI bMgl ]
transliteration: Karat Nrit Soundaribajat Beenaa Dhoun Mandal|| Oupjat Raag Sanbooh Bajat Bairaaribanad||
translation: The beautiful damsels played on lyres, sang songs of joy and danced; the collective sound of musical modes was heard; Bairari, Bangali female musical modes were played;

gurmukhi: BYrv rwg bsMq dIp ihMfol mhwsur ] auGtq qwn qrMg sunq rIJq Dun sur nr ]
transliteration: Bhairav Raag Basant Deep Hindol Mahaasur|| Oughtat Taan Taran Sounat Reejhat Dhrn Sur Nar||
translation: The fine sound of Bhairava, Basant, Deepak, Hindol etc. arose at such a pitch that all the men women were allured;

gurmukhi: ieh Cb pRBwv irq rwj niRp jidn ros kir Dwie hY ] ibn iek ibbyk qw ky niRpq Aaur smuih ko jwie hY ]171]
transliteration: Eh Chhab Prabhaav Rit Raaj Nrip Jahin Ros Kar(i) Dhaae Hai|| Bin Ik Bibek Taa Ke Nripat Aur Samuh(i) Ko Jaae Hai||171||
translation: With the impact of all this demeanour, O king ! the day on which he will attack, then who can face him, without adopting Vivek?171.

gurmukhi: swrMg su`D mlwr ibBws srb gn ] rwmklI ihMfol gOf gUjrI mhwN Dun ]
transliteration: Saaran Suddh Malaar Bibhaas Sarab Gad|| Raamkalihindol Gaddd Goojrimahaan Dhoun||
translation: Seeing and hearing he elegant tunes of Sarang, Shuddh Malhar, Vibhas, Ramkali, Hindol, Gaur, Gujri,

gurmukhi: llq prj gvrI mlHwr kwnVw mhw Cib ] jwih iblokq bIr srb qumry jYhY dib ]
transliteration: Lalat Paraj Gadrimalhaar Kaandaa Mahaan Chhab(i)|| Jaah(i) Bilokat Beer Sarab Toumre Jaihai Dab(i)||
translation: Lalit, Paraj, Gauri, Malhar, Kanra etc., the warriors like you are buried under his dazzle;

gurmukhi: ieh ibD nryS irq rwj niRp mdn sUAn jb grj hY ] ibnu ie`k gXwn sunho niRpiq su Aaur dUsr ko brij hY ]172]
transliteration: Eh Bidh Daresh Rit Raaj Nrip Makan Sooan Jab Gadaj Hai|| Bin(u) Ikk Gyaan Sounoh Nripat(i) Su Aur Doosar Ko Baraj(i) Hai||172||
translation: In this way, in the good season Basant, when Avivek will thunder in the likeness of the god of love, then without knowledge, O king ! who will admonish him ? 172.

gurmukhi: kauDq dwmn sGn sGn Gorq chuids Gn ] moihq Bwmn sGn frq ibrhin qiRX lK mn ]
transliteration: Kaudhat Daamanndsaghan Saghan Ghorat Chahudis Ghan|| Mohit Bhaamanndsaghan Darat Birhan(i) Triya Lakh Man||
translation: When the clouds will surround from all the four directions, the lightnings will flash, in such an atmosphere, the love-sick women will allure the mind;
